Master Answer:
The routine BC immunization schedule was different in 2004/2005 and the Measles, Mumps, Rubella (MMR) Vaccine was given at 12 and 18 months of age. Two doses of the MMR vaccine given after 12 months of age (at least 4 weeks apart) are considered valid doses and no further doses are recommended for protection against measles.
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: My son born in 2004 had MMR immunizations on May 2005 and another dose November 2005 as per the recommendations on his Child Health Passport. (2nd dose 12 months after 3rd immunization). His 3rd immunization was November, 2004. Does he need another dose? Thanks
